definition[0]: to do something bad, extreme, or difficult because you cannot think of any other way to deal with a problem
example[0]: Officials fear that extremists may resort to violence.
example[1]: Vets have had to resort to killing the animals.
definition[1]: to take a bad or unpleasant course of action because everything else has failed
example[2]: The company may resort to a temporary closure of its only plant.
example[3]: We regret we must resort to legal action.
